_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This Risk Management Program (RMP) applies to the Wegmans Retail Service Center located at 820 Keystone Boulevard in the Highridge Business Park, Pottsville, Pennsylvania.  The RMP has been prepared in accordance with the Federal Clean Air Act (Section 112(r) and associated regulations in Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 68.  The facility supplies refrigerated fresh foods to Wegmans stores.  In order to provide the proper temperature climate for the food, an anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system is used.  This type of system is commonly used at many refrigerated and frozen foods facilities, as it is safe, economical and reliable.

The Retail Service Center refrigeration system has 15,597 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  Following are the required seven elements of the executive summary for the Retail Service Center (68 CFR 168.155):

1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies

The Retail Service Center complies with all Federal, State and local requirements for ammonia-refrigerated facilities.  The facility was designed and constructed in accordance with applicable industry standards and codes.  The facility is continually monitored by ammonia detection sensors, which are wired directly to Wegmans Loss Prevention Control Station.  In the event of an ammonia release, 911 will be called and the local fire departments and HazMat teams will respond with the assistance of the Schuylkill County Emergency Management Agency, if necessary.  The facility has a written set of emergency response procedures.

2. Stationary source and regulated substances handled

The facility is a perishable food warehouse and central shipping point supplying Wegmans Food Markets stores.  The facility uses 15,597 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.  

3. Off-Site Consequence Analysis OCA

Under EPA 550-F-04-002, March 2004 Changes to the Chemical Accident Prevention Rule (Risk Management Program) in 2004, the ?worst case? release scenario is not included as par

t of the Executive Summary.  It is, however, part of the RMP submission.

4. General accidental release prevention program and chemical specific prevention steps

The facility complies with EPA?s Risk Management Program requirements and all applicable state and local codes and standards in effect at the time the facility was constructed.

5. Five-year accident history

There have not been any releases from this facility in the past five years.

6. Emergency Response Program

In the event of an ammonia release, the facility will contact 911 and request local fire departments and HazMat teams report to the facility.  The facility?s ammonia detection system is directly linked to Wegmans
